definition:
A is said to be *distributive* if it satisifes either (and therefore
both) of the :

-   $x \land (y \lor z) = (x \land y) \lor (x \land z)$

-   $x \lor (y \land z) = (x \lor y) \land (x \lor z)$

Every distributive lattice is .

Examples of distributive lattices include , totally ordered sets, and
the of locally cyclic groups.
